intro: Saccolabium aureum, commonly known as golden saccolabium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are trifoliate, with three small, oval-shaped leaflets. The seeds are enclosed in a pod and are often dispersed by wind, contributing to its distribution across its native range.
